repnme.cdata!:
Republic of Yemen - Seeds and Agricultural
            Services Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Project ratings are as follows: Project
            outcome is satisfactory; sustainability is likely;
            institutional development impact is substantial; Bank
            performance is satisfactory; and Borrower performance is
            satisfactory. Several lessons were gleaned from this
            project: Among the sectoral-related lessons were these: The
            unique microclimatic situation should be taken into account
            during the implementation stage in future projects for seed
            variety development and testing activities.  Considering
            that about 60 percent of agriculture in Yemen is under
            rainfed conditions, follow-on projects should place more
            emphasis on rainfed agriculture. The use of farmers'
            cooperatives in the production and dissemination of local
            varieties proved to be fruitful under this project. The use
            of farmers' cooperatives in project implementation and
            the training of extension staff have made positive changes
            for poor rural households and beneficiaries; this concept
            should be broadened and replicated in other sectors and also
            at the national level. Further success of the Vegetable Seed
            Company can be enhanced by developing an aggressive
            market-oriented program. Implementation -related lessons
            highlighted the simple and straight forward design, the
            focused approach on a limited number of activities, the
            recognition of the importance of farmer empowerment, the
            need to apprise Borrowers of the relevance and significance
            of procurement and disbursement procedures in avoiding
            implementation delays, setting the legal framework before
            project implementation, the need to put in place a simpler
            institutional set-up, the need to align project and
            government policy, and to closely monitor quality control
            and the implementation of the cooperatives mandates.

repnme.cdata!:
Republic of Yemen - Seeds and Agricultural
            Services Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the Seeds
            and Agricultural Services Project is to improve agricultural
            productivity of rainfed and irrigated crops. Four components
            comprise the project: 1) promoting information media
            campaigns to encourage private operators to enter the seed
            and fertilizer subsectors, to increase farmers' use of
            quality seeds and fertilizers, and to build the capacity of
            the governmental agency implementing seed and fertilizer
            quality control; 2) seed sourcing and variety testing, and
            restructuring existing seed centers to commercialize and
            privatize their operations; 3) expanding input supply
            marketing channels to address the undersupply of inputs due
            to existing private sector oligopolies; and 4) establishing
            a project support unit to ensure proper and timely
            implementation of project procurement, disbursement,
            accounting and monitoring, and evaluation activities.

Republic of Yemen - Seeds and Agricultural
